title: farming Farmers warn of 'welfare crisis' as new, stricter stocking rates confirmed - Irish Examiner
summary: Irish dairy farmers are facing an impending animal welfare crisis if they are forced to cull heavily pregnant cows to meet new, stricter stocking rates. The European Commission has made it clear that its derogation decision will not change, and the department has confirmed that where land crosses between boundaries, the limit will be calculated on a “parcel-by-parcel basis.” Farmers have less than three months to comply with the new regulations.
company: Irish Creamery and Milk Suppliers Association
